value.title: Scale Your Cloud App with Azure Cache for Redis | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Ye Gu joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Cache for Redis, a popular open-source in-memory data store that uses DRAM to store the most frequently used or time-sensitive data for fast retrieval. With it, you can create applications on Azure that handle millions of requests per second at down to sub-millisecond
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/K7_gnzge6Oc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Serverless geo-distributed applications with Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Matias Quaranta joins Scott Hanselman to share some best practices for creating serverless geo-distributed applications with Azure Cosmos DB. With the native integration between Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions, you can create database triggers, input bindings, and output bindings directly from your

value.title: What database you should use in your next Azure Functions app | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this episode of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn what database you should use for your next Azure Functions app.   For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. value.title: Will my SQL Server database run on Azure SQL? | One Dev Question: Laurent Bugnion
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Cloud Developer Advocate Laurent Bugnion explains various development features of Azure.
